pageContext.claim: “Wisconsin dairy farms were decimated under -- Obama, Biden. Under the USMCA our dairy exports to Canada -- are expected to surge by 50 to 100 percent, and very quickly.”
pageContext.analysis: Laying aside Trump's usual criticism of Obama, his claims about future dairy exports to Canada are too optimistic. Before USMCA, the U.S. exported $675 million in dairy products to Canada a year, with some estimates that trade could eventually increase by $300 million. That would be about a 50 percent increase, but a Merrill Lynch research report suggested the gain would only be about $70 million. As for "very quickly," farmers quickly complained Canada was dragging its feet on implementing tariff-rate quotas and so in December, the U.S. Trade Representative announced the very first enforcement action to ensure compliance with the agreement.
